remarks: The inverse of a Dirichlet character is the conjugate (which is also the multiplicative inverse, because the values of ` X ` are unimodular). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Apr-2016.)
statement:
dchrabs.g $e |- G = ( DChr ` N ) $.
dchrabs.d $e |- D = ( Base ` G ) $.
dchrabs.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. D ) $.
dchrinv.i $e |- I = ( invg ` G ) $.
dchrinv $p |- ( ph -> ( I ` X ) = ( * o. X ) ) $.
